<!-- edited by Noelle Murata [fiveinchpixie@gmail.com]  -->

The `byte-streams` module provides streams for reading and writing bytes.

constructors.name: ByteReader
constructors.description: Creates a binary input stream that reads bytes from a backing stream.

methods.name: close
methods.description:
Closes both the stream and its backing stream.  If the stream is already
closed, an exception is thrown.

methods.name: read

returns.description:
A string containing the bytes read.  If the stream is at the end, returns the
empty string.

params.name: numBytes
params.description:
The number of bytes to read.  If not given, the remainder of the entire stream
is read.

methods.description:
Reads a string from the stream.  If the stream is closed, an exception is
thrown.

properties.name: closed
properties.description: True if the stream is closed.

constructors.name: ByteWriter
constructors.description: Creates a binary output stream that writes bytes to a backing stream.

methods.name: close
methods.description:
Closes both the stream and its backing stream.  If the stream is already
closed, an exception is thrown.

methods.name: write
methods.description:
Writes a string to the stream.  If the stream is closed, an exception is
thrown.

properties.name: closed
properties.description: True if the stream is closed.
